description: This column is about storing the names of authors in the library system.

This column is about storing the canonical name of the authors in the public schema of the database. The canonical name is a unique and standardized representation of the author's name, which can be used for identification and reference purposes within the library system.

examples: Jane Austen was an English novelist known for her six major novels that interpret, critique and comment upon the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.
Charles Dickens was an English writer and social critic who created some of the world's best-known fictional characters and is regarded by many as the greatest novelist of the Victorian era.
Maya Angelou was an American poet, memoirist, and civil rights activist known for her series of seven autobiographies, which focus on her childhood and early adult experiences.
F. Scott Fitzgerald was an American novelist and short story writer whose works illustrate the Jazz Age.
Toni Morrison was an American novelist, essayist, editor, and professor known for her examination of the black experience in America through her rich and eloquent storytelling.
Leo Tolstoy was a Russian novelist known for his two longest works, War and Peace and Anna Karenina, often cited as pinnacles of realist fiction.
J.K. Rowling is a British author known for the Harry Potter fantasy series, which has gained worldwide attention, won multiple awards, and sold more than 500 million copies.
Harper Lee was an American novelist widely known for her novel To Kill a Mockingbird, which won the Pulitzer Prize and is considered a classic of modern American literature.
Herman Melville was an American novelist, short story writer, and poet of the American Renaissance period, best known for his novel Moby-Dick.
Emily Dickinson was an American poet who lived a largely introverted and reclusive life, producing unique poetry characterized by its unconventional punctuation and syntax.
Gabriel Garcia Marquez was a Colombian novelist and Nobel Prize winner known for his magical realist style and works such as One Hundred Years of Solitude.
Mark Twain was an American writer and humorist known for his novels The Adventures of Tom Sawyer and Adventures of Huckleberry Finn, often called the
Virginia Woolf was an English writer, considered one of the most important modernist 20th-century authors and known for her novels, essays, and influential feminist works.
Langston Hughes was an American poet, social activist, and playwright known for his involvement in the Harlem Renaissance and his innovative use of jazz rhythms in his poetry.
Agatha Christie was an English writer known for her detective novels, particularly those revolving around the fictional detectives Hercule Poirot and Miss Marple.
Ernest Hemingway was an American novelist and short story writer known for his understated prose style and depiction of American and European expatriate life.
Louisa May Alcott was an American novelist best known for the novel Little Women and its sequels, which are based on her childhood experiences with her three sisters.
Oscar Wilde was an Irish poet and playwright known for his wit, flamboyant style, and the novel The Picture of Dorian Gray and the play The Importance of Being Earnest.
George Orwell was an English novelist, essayist, journalist, and critic known for his dystopian novel Nineteen Eighty-Four and allegorical novella Animal Farm.
Jane Goodall is a British primatologist and anthropologist known for her groundbreaking work studying the behavior of wild chimpanzees in Tanzania.
description: This column is about storing the biographies of authors in the library system. It would contain information such as the background, achievements, and other relevant details about the authors.

This column is about the role of the book contributors in the library system. It may indicate whether the contributor is an author, editor, publisher, illustrator, or any other relevant role related to the books in the library.

examples: Co-authored by Lily Chang and Mark Thompson
Cover design by Graphic Design Studio
Chapter summaries by the Book Club Members
Review by the Literary Critic Society
Special thanks to the Research Fund sponsors
Dedicated to all the Grammar Enthusiasts
In memory of the Beloved Author, Jane Wilson
description: This column is about storing the credit text for book contributors in the library system. It may include details about the contributors' roles, such as author, editor, illustrator, translator, etc., as well as any other relevant information regarding their contribution to a particular book.
This column is about storing the copy number assigned to each physical copy of a book in the library system.
This column is about storing the unique barcode associated with each book copy in a library system.
This column is about storing the International Standard Book Number (ISBN) in 13-digit format for identifying a specific book edition in the library system.

examples: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
description: This column is about storing the title of the book editions in the library system.

examples: A Complete Guide to Gardening for Beginners
Thrilling Adventures in the Amazon Rainforest
Cooking Techniques from Around the World
Healthy Living: Mind, Body, and Spirit
Great American Novels: A Literary Companion
The Art of Surrealism: A Visual Journey
Exploring the Wonders of Underwater Life
DIY Home Improvement Projects Made Easy
From Paris with Love: Romantic Escapades
The History of Jazz: A Musical Odyssey
The Ultimate Guide to Outdoor Photography
Delicious Vegan Recipes for Every Occasion
Leading Through Change: Strategies for Success
Thriving in a Digital Age: Navigating the Technological Landscape
description: This column is about the subtitle of the book editions in the library system. It contains additional information or a secondary title that complements the main title of the book.
This column is about storing the language in which each book edition is written. It is used to specify the language of the book for users to search and filter by language in the library system.
This column stores the country where a specific book edition is located in the library system.

examples: Due date extended by librarian until next week
Item returned damaged, please contact patron for reimbursement
Patron requested a hold on 'The Great Gatsby' for next month
Overdue fees waived due to system error
Book 'Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone' lost, replacement copy ordered
New library card issued to patron with ID verification
Multiple renewals for 'The Hobbit' granted for student's research project
Reminder sent to patron for overdue DVD 'The Avengers'
Patron reported issue with online renewal system, investigating
Request for interlibrary loan of 'Pride and Prejudice' from another branch
Library closed for renovation, no returns accepted until reopening
Item 'To Kill a Mockingbird' missing from shelf, searching for it
Notified patron that 'The Hunger Games' ebook now available for borrowing
Reminder sent to patron for holds waiting to be picked up
Special request from patron for large print edition of 'Twilight'
Overnight loan approved for 'The Da Vinci Code' for visiting scholar
Updated patron's contact information for notifications
Reshelving 'Dracula' after being left on study table
Staff meeting scheduled to discuss new borrowing policies
Investigating noise complaint during book club meeting in study room
description: This column is about storing additional notes or comments related to borrowing transactions in a library system.
This column is about storing the names of collections in the library system. Collections could refer to categories of books, author lists, or any other grouping of items within the library.

examples: Explore a vast collection of classic literature spanning different genres and eras.
Discover a diverse selection of contemporary art books featuring emerging and established artists.
Uncover hidden gems in our rare books collection, including first editions and signed copies.
Dive into the world of science fiction with our extensive collection of novels and graphic novels.
Embark on a journey through history with our historical fiction collection, covering various time periods.
Immerse yourself in poetry from renowned poets and emerging voices alike.
Get lost in the pages of mystery and suspense novels from popular authors.
Learn about different cultures and traditions through our collection of world literature.
Find inspiration in our collection of self-help and personal development books.
Escape to magical realms with our fantasy and science fiction collection.
Explore the wonders of the natural world through our collection of nature and wildlife books.
Unearth captivating stories from around the globe in our international fiction collection.
Delve into the minds of great thinkers with our philosophy and critical theory collection.
Experience the thrill of adventure with our collection of action-packed novels.
Discover the art of cooking and baking with our extensive collection of cookbooks.
Learn about different art movements and techniques through our art history collection.
Explore the mysteries of the universe with our collection of astronomy and space exploration books.
Travel back in time with historical biographies and non-fiction accounts.
Immerse yourself in the world of fashion and design with our fashion books collection.
Find solace and comfort in our collection of inspirational and spiritual books.
description: This column is about storing descriptions of the various collections available in the library system.
This column is about categorizing the type of collection in the library system, such as books, magazines, journals, etc.

examples: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
description: This column contains the official or standardized title of a book in the general books collection. It is designed to uniquely identify each book and provide a consistent reference across the library system.

This column is about storing the unique identifier (ID) of the provider associated with an authentication identity. It likely links to a table or entity that contains more details about the provider, such as their name, contact information, etc.

This column is about storing the identity provider of the author in the context of user authentication and authorization. It could indicate whether the author has signed in using a specific service or platform, such as Google, Facebook, or a custom authentication system.
This column is about storing the type of response for a user's invitation in the library system. It could indicate whether the user accepted, declined, or ignored the invitation.

description: This column is about storing the user-agent information related to the responses of invitations in the public.invitation_responses table. The user-agent typically refers to the web browser or application used by the user when responding to an invitation. It may contain details such as the browser name, version, and operating system, which can provide insights into the user's device and environment.

examples: Unable to attend due to prior commitment
Will be late, but will attend
RSVP'd for +1, additional dietary restrictions for guest
Sending regrets as I will be out of town
Attending only cocktail hour, not the main event
Bringing a vegan dessert to share
Best wishes to the couple, unable to attend
Notes: Red wine allergy, will bring my own drinks
Excited to attend, looking forward to seeing everyone
Unable to attend due to illness, sending a gift instead
Guest is a minor, please ensure non-alcoholic options available
Driving with a group, requesting parking instructions
Will attend virtually via Zoom link provided
Not comfortable with indoor gatherings, unable to attend
Requested song dedication at the reception
Surprise gift for the hosts, delivering it earlier
No preferences, happy to go with the flow
description: This column is for storing any additional notes or comments related to the response to an invitation.
This column is about storing the email addresses of users who have been invited to join the library system or perform certain actions within the system.
This column is about specifying the role associated with the invitation. It could indicate the type of access or permission level the recipient will have once they accept the invitation.
This column is about the type of invitation being sent to users, such as inviting them to join the library system, attend a book club event, or participate in a special author Q&A session.

examples: We would love for you to join us at our wedding on June 15th!
Looking forward to seeing you at the conference next week.
Hey there! It's been a while. Let's catch up over coffee this weekend.
Excited to invite you to our housewarming party on Saturday!
You're invited to the grand opening of our new restaurant! Can't wait to celebrate with you.
Join us for a fun evening of games and laughter at our game night on Friday.
Happy birthday! We're throwing a surprise party for you this Saturday.
Don't forget to RSVP for the charity gala next month. It's going to be an inspiring event.
We miss you! Come over for a barbecue this Sunday.
Save the date for our baby shower on May 5th. We can't wait to welcome our little one.
Join us for a hike in the mountains this weekend. It's going to be an adventure!
You're invited to our book club meeting next Wednesday. Get ready for some lively discussions.
Exciting news – we're hosting a movie night at our place this Friday. Popcorn and movies galore!
We're having a potluck dinner on Sunday. Bring your favorite dish and let's feast together.
It's time for our annual holiday party! Mark your calendar for December 20th.
Celebrate with us at our engagement party on Saturday. Love is in the air!
Join us for a beach cleanup this Saturday. Let's make a positive impact together.
We're hosting a DIY workshop at our home. Get ready to unleash your creativity!
You're invited to our farewell party next weekend as we bid adieu to old memories and welcome new beginnings.
Looking forward to having you at our graduation celebration. Your presence will make it even more special.
description: This column is about storing personal messages that are associated with invitations sent to users. These messages may include personalized content or specific details related to the invitation, such as event information or context for the invitation.
This column is about storing the names of public libraries within the library system.
This column stores the unique code associated with each library in the database. It is used to identify and distinguish different libraries in the system.
This column contains unique identifiers for each member in the library system.

examples: The library staff was very helpful in assisting me to find the books I needed.
I really enjoyed the quiet atmosphere in the library, perfect for studying.
The selection of books in this library is amazing, I found some rare titles I've been searching for.
I found the library to be overcrowded and it was difficult to find a quiet spot to read.
The library's online catalog made it easy for me to reserve and pick up books at my convenience.
The librarians were knowledgeable and provided great recommendations on new releases.
I attended a book reading session at the library and it was a wonderful experience.
The library's study rooms were clean and well-equipped with power outlets, perfect for group projects.
The library's cafe offers delicious coffee and pastries, a great spot to take a break between study sessions.
I was disappointed with the library's limited hours, it's challenging to visit during my busy schedule.
The library's digital resources are comprehensive and user-friendly, making research much easier.
The children's section in the library is colorful and inviting, my kids love coming here.
I wish the library had more events and workshops to engage the community.
The library's staff is always friendly and ready to help with any inquiries.
The library's collection of audiobooks is impressive, great for commuters like me.
I appreciate the library's efforts in promoting local authors through book signings and talks.
The library's historical archives are a treasure trove of information about the local area.
The library's seating areas are comfortable and conducive to long hours of reading.
I love the fact that the library offers free access to online academic journals, it's a huge help for my studies.
The library's mobile app is convenient for checking due dates and renewing borrowed books on the go.
description: This column is about storing the content of reviews written by users in the library system.

description: This column is about storing the user agent information associated with authentication sessions in the library system. It likely contains details about the device, browser, and operating system used by the user during the session.

This column is about tagging sessions for user authentication in the library system. It may include information such as session IDs, tags for different types of authentication, or any other relevant session tagging data.

examples: Sharing a book on social media
description: This column is about storing the type of event that occurred in the transaction events table. It could include actions like borrowing a book, writing a review, following an author, managing preferences, or other similar user interactions in the library system.

examples: Book returned by John Smith. Fine paid in full.
Due date extended for 'The Great Gatsby' for Mary Johnson.
User complaints received about noise level in the library.
Late return of 'Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone' by Sarah Brown.
Maintenance scheduled for reading tables on the 2nd floor.
Student lost ID card. Access to library restricted until resolved.
New library policy implemented for reservation of study rooms.
Multiple copies of 'To Kill a Mockingbird' requested for book club.
Computer system down; unable to process book checkouts.
Library staff meeting scheduled for next Monday at 9:00 AM.
Book '1984' reported missing from the shelves.
Reminder sent to users with overdue books to return them promptly.
Book 'Pride and Prejudice' requested for interlibrary loan.
Presentation on digital resources planned for next week.
Library closed early due to inclement weather.
Unauthorized poster found in the library. Removed by staff.
New librarian orientation session planned for next month.
Book 'The Catcher in the Rye' damaged; replacement ordered.
Request for new subscriptions to academic journals submitted.
Workshop on research skills scheduled for graduate students.
description: This column is about storing additional information or notes related to transaction events within the library system. This could include details about book transactions, user interactions, or any other relevant information.

This column is about storing the email address of the user profiles in the public schema of the database. It is used to uniquely identify users and for communication purposes within the library system.
This column is about storing the user's chosen display name for their profile on the library system.
This column is about storing the URL link to the avatar image of a user's profile. It will contain the path to the image that represents the user visually within the library system.

examples: I am a bookworm who loves diving into the world of fantasy novels. My favorite authors are J.K. Rowling and George R.R. Martin.
An avid reader of mystery and thriller books, always on the lookout for the next gripping story. Agatha Christie is my all-time favorite.
I have a passion for history and enjoy exploring different cultures through historical fiction novels. My favorite era is the Victorian period.
A sci-fi enthusiast who is fascinated by futuristic technologies and extraterrestrial adventures. Isaac Asimov and Philip K. Dick are my go-to authors.
A lover of classic literature, especially Shakespeare's works. Nothing beats a cozy evening with a Jane Austen novel in hand.
I am a poetry aficionado who finds solace in the verses of Rumi and Pablo Neruda. Poetry is where I seek beauty and meaning.
A non-fiction buff who thrives on self-improvement and personal development books. Learning is a lifelong journey I embrace wholeheartedly.
A fan of autobiographies and memoirs, discovering intriguing life stories from different walks of life. Each person's journey is a tale worth exploring.
An advocate for social justice and equality, passionate about reading books that shed light on important societal issues and inspire change.
I am a travel enthusiast who dreams of exploring the world and immersing myself in diverse cultures. Armchair travel through travelogues keeps my wanderlust alive.
A nature lover who finds peace in the great outdoors, always reaching for books that celebrate the beauty of our natural world. John Muir's writings resonate deeply with me.
A foodie at heart, constantly on the hunt for new recipes and culinary adventures. Cookbooks are my treasure trove for creative cooking inspiration.
A fitness fanatic who believes in the power of a healthy mind and body. Health and wellness books guide me in my journey towards a balanced lifestyle.
I am an artist who draws inspiration from art history and contemporary art movements. Art books are my muse, fueling my creativity and imagination.
A music aficionado with a diverse taste in genres, from classical to rock to jazz. Biographies of legendary musicians offer a glimpse into their creative genius.
A cinephile obsessed with movies and filmmaking, always eager to delve into the world of cinema through film analyses and director biographies.
An aspiring writer who finds comfort in the craft of storytelling. Writing guides and author interviews inspire me to pursue my literary ambitions.
A history buff fascinated by ancient civilizations and archaeological discoveries. Books on ancient history transport me to bygone eras rich with intrigue.
A science enthusiast who is captivated by the mysteries of the universe. Popular science books make complex concepts accessible and ignite my curiosity.
A technology geek who stays up to date with the latest innovations and tech trends. Tech magazines and blogs are my sources of tech enlightenment.
description: This column is about storing the biographical information of users' profiles in the library system. It may include details about the users such as their interests, favorite genres, book preferences, personal description, etc.
This column is about storing unique identifiers for users in the database table.

This column is about storing the role of the users in the library system. It defines the level of access and permissions that the users have within the system, such as 'admin', 'librarian', 'member', etc.
This column is about storing the email addresses of users who are registered in the library system. It is used for user identification, communication, and account management purposes.
This column is about storing the encrypted password of users in the library system for authentication purposes.
This column is a token used for confirming user accounts in the library system. It is likely generated and sent to users to verify their email addresses or enable their accounts after registration.
This column is used to store the recovery token assigned to a user for the purpose of recovering their account in case they forget their password or encounter login issues.

This column is used to store the token generated when a user requests to change their email address in the library system. The token is used to confirm and validate the email change process for the user.
This column is about storing the new email address that a user wants to change to. It is likely used in cases where a user requests to change their email address in the system.
